overview:
## Discussion

When implementing [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Cancellable] in support of a custom publisher, implement `cancel()` to request that your publisher stop calling its downstream subscribers. Combine doesn’t require that the publisher stop immediately, but the `cancel()` call should take effect quickly. Canceling should also eliminate any strong references it currently holds.

After you receive one call to `cancel()`, subsequent calls shouldn’t do anything. Additionally, your implementation must be thread-safe, and it shouldn’t block the caller.

# cancel()

**Instance Method**

Cancel the activity.

## Declaration

```swift
func cancel()
```

## Discussion

When implementing [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Cancellable] in support of a custom publisher, implement `cancel()` to request that your publisher stop calling its downstream subscribers. Combine doesn’t require that the publisher stop immediately, but the `cancel()` call should take effect quickly. Canceling should also eliminate any strong references it currently holds.

After you receive one call to `cancel()`, subsequent calls shouldn’t do anything. Additionally, your implementation must be thread-safe, and it shouldn’t block the caller.
title: cancel()
